ranked_diseases.explanation: Strong match with rod-cone dystrophy, intellectual disability, brachydactyly, and developmental delays. BBS1 is the most common form and presents with this constellation of features.
Presents with intellectual disability, developmental delays, characteristic facial features (downslanted palpebral fissures, micrognathia, low-set ears), short stature, and retinal dystrophy.
Features rod-cone dystrophy, short stature, and developmental delays, though typically includes obesity and hearing loss which are not mentioned in this case.
Another subtype of BBS with similar features including retinal dystrophy, intellectual disability, and skeletal abnormalities, though less common than BBS1.
Presents with rod-cone dystrophy and can have developmental delays, but typically includes nephronophthisis which is not mentioned here.
Can present with intellectual disability, developmental delays, and eye abnormalities. The Chiari malformation could represent cerebellar involvement typical of Joubert syndrome.
Another BBS subtype with similar clinical features but less frequently reported, includes retinal dystrophy and developmental abnormalities.
Shares some features with BBS including brachydactyly and developmental delays, though typically presents with hydrometrocolpos in females.
